intro: Pagamea puberula, commonly known as the hairy pagamea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
